Header: PM decides to keep away from Chairmanship of the Dayaka Sabha of the Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihare
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe has decided to keep away from the Chairmanship of the Dayaka Sabha until the Chief Incumbent of the Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihare is acquitted of property charges levelled against him. Accordingly reports that the Prime Minister has been removed as Chairman of the Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihare are false. The Prime Minister has decided to keep away from the Chairmanship of the Dayaka Sabha as he cannot have any links over the responsibilities of the charges levelled against the Chief Incumbent of the Vihare. The United National Party has clarified reports that the Prime Minister has been removed as Chairman of the Klaniya Raja Maha Vihare Chairmanship and published in the social media. The UNP said that Prime Minister has pointed out that it is important that the Chief Incumbent be acquitted of all charges. Also the Prime Minister did not attend the Dayaka Sabha meeting held yesterday and that he is not aware of a a decision taken by a small group.
